thread.title: On Lexington Way: Kids' market, pumpkin walk and fall festival this weekend | Hudsonvalley360.com | dailygazette.com
thread.title_full: On Lexington Way: Kids' market, pumpkin walk and fall festival this weekend | Hudsonvalley360.com | dailygazette.com

author: Chris Dwon
title: On Lexington Way: Kids' market, pumpkin walk and fall festival this weekend | Hudsonvalley360.com | dailygazette.com
text:
On Saturday, Oct. 11, from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m., under the pavilion at the Lexington Municipal Building, 3542 Route 42, the Lexington Farmers Market will hold a Kids Day Market. All your favorite vendors will be there. The town of Lexington Fire/Rescue Company will have fire/rescue equipment for the kiddos to check out. Come and meet your local volunteer heroes. Steven Weinberg, author and artist, will be there from 10 to 11 a.m. Free ice cream sundaes donated by Stewart’s Shops. Hunter Public Library will have free children’s books. Sing-a-long with Kim Do and Slow Baby Fox. Arts and crafts tables all day. Gardening demos for kids and adults, worm composting, fall transplanting tips and a bulb swap. There will be a winter coat drive for those in need. Please bring new or gently used clean warm clothing for distribution through the Hunter-Tannersville Central School District.
The annual Great Pumpkin Walk and Lighting will take place on Saturday, Oct. 11, from 7 to 8 p.m. at Tannersville Lake. Registration is 7 p.m. Lighting at 7:30 p.m. Awards at 8 p.m. Bring your best carved pumpkin and candle. For more information call 518-858-9094.
